MES 45.title: Introduction to Middle East Studies
MES 45.description: Surveys the peoples, cultures, and societies of the wider Middle East with a focus on contemporary social, economic, and political life and structure. Course examines among others such concepts as tradition, modernity, autocracy, democracy and political transition.

MES 145.title: Model Arab League
MES 145.comments: May be repeated for credit to a maximum of 12 units but only 8 units can count toward the major.
MES 145.description: In-depth study of political, strategic, economic, cultural, and environmental issues in the Arab world as seen from the perspective of the Arab League. Each year a different Arab country is the focus. Students also practice causcusing, speaking, and drafting resolutions.

MES 195.title: Senior Honors Thesis
MES 195.prereq_description: Consent of instructor and department; senior standing; open to Middle East Studies majors who have a 3.5 overall GPA and a 3.75 GPA in the major
MES 195.description: Projects for advanced work in Middle East Studies in conjunction with individual members of the faculty and developed by students. For students who wish to graduate with distinction in the Middle East Studies major.
